- move their parent to another column
- now try to drag another issue above these subs, it is not possible as the parent (in another column) is still ranked higher.

how can we solve this?

As a Rapid Board user I would like the ability to plan future sprints

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-3811].
  {panel}

If I go to a project's *Agile* tab, then on the right click on the *Hours*, *Issues*, or *Flow* tab, I do not see more than 1 day's worth of data if the selected version's *Start date* is blank. This makes these charts useless.

Attached is an example from a project that has been ongoing for about 2 weeks and which will end in about 3.5 weeks. All I see is what happened today. This gives me no clue of where we're coming from or whether I have appropriate progress.

The same happens if I create a Greenhopper Agile Gadget on my dashboard.

It would be better if the chart would start from the start date of the earliest recorded work or meaningful action on an issue (e.g., not the issue's creation date) if the version lacks a start date.
fields.summary: Charts start on first day of recorded work if no start date specified for version

fields.description: As a project manager I want to navigate easily between planning boards and task boards of different projects and versions so that I don't need to several clicks with the mouse. The current style implementation which uses several drop down menus is pretty slow and irritating to use.
fields.summary: Improve usability of Jira Greenhopper
Perform a reindex in the upgrade task
Remove Obsolete Rank fields from any issue navigator column configurations
Check the contexts are correctly migrated to the replacement Rank field (ie, not on the Obsolete field)

fields.description: Send to top/bottom ranks against the first/last rankable against issue, so normal issues against subtasks and subtasks against subtasks. This is not entirely correct, as a parent can be ranked against a subtask, in which case the parent of the subtask would be used to rank against.
fields.summary: Send to top/bottom does not work properly if first/last issue is subtask

fields.description:
There are currently a number of customer comments on the page asking for examples of how or when one might effectively use contexts. I tend to agree - being a new user, it is not immediately clear how this functionality can help the customer. The first place they would turn to would be documentation, but aside from the technicalities of what is displayed in each screen, there is no high-level overview of what Contexts are useful for.

One question that might prompt better clarification could be: 
What if I wanted a quick way to see a subset of my issues on the Planning Board?

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Using+Contexts+to+Filter+and+Highlight+Issues
fields.summary: Add usage example to the Contexts page to clarify what Contexts are good for

fields.description:
From the JIRA 4.4 Plugin Upgrade Guide:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Plugin+Developer+Notes+for+JIRA+4.4#PluginDeveloperNotesforJIRA44-Tabnavigationinadminsection
fields.summary: As a JIRA Administrator I would like GreenHopper to show the admin menus properly

fields.description:
Currently the planning board allows filtering by version and component. It would be nice to be able to filter by (multiple) issue Types, e.g. to be able to now show bugs. 

This should be added in the url so a posted url could open the Planning board as desired.
fields.summary: Task board - add Filtering on label

fields.description:
The version synchroniser is not working when resolving an issue.

Suppose I have the following version hierarchy :
Version 1
 +---- Version 1.2
 +---- Version 1.2
Version 2
 +---- Version 2.2
 +---- Version 2.2

In the GreenHopper Listeners configuration, I activated the Versions Synchoniser.

If I edit an issue and I change the FixVersion to "1.2", the Versions Synchroniser will properly update the fix version to "Version1, Version1.2"

However, if I set the FixVersion to "1.2" in the "resolving an issue" popup, then the fix version wont be updated following the version hierarchy.
fields.summary: Versions synchroniser not working when resolving issues

fields.description:
(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: What happens in the case with an issue that has a subtask not captured by the filter?
A: (/) Nothing - the count is for parent issues and not sub-tasks, so the count will not be affected.

Q: Test to see this works with Stories Swimlane config, as well as Queries.
A: (/) Still works, though it is less clear what the issue count refers to given that you do not see the parent issue in the column it is in.

Q: What about negative numbers?
A: (/) They continue to not be allowed - same input controls for constraints as before.

Q: Is this customizable for individual constraints, or globally for all constraints?
A: (/) For the whole board, not individual columns

Q: What if the last parent is removed from that column but it's subtasks remain?
A: (/) The count drops to zero.

Q: What happens if there is no subtask issuetype?
A: (/) Nothing - the count should not be affected by issues which do not exist

Q: What happens when there are quick filters active that filter out parent issues? What happens when there are quick filters active that filter out sub-task issues?
A: (/) The count should still display the appropriate number of issues - so if column constraint excludes sub tasks then filtering out parents should set all visible counts to 0.
fields.summary: As a rapid board owner I would like to be able to have a column constraint for "Issues, excluding Sub-Tasks"

fields.description:
Please implement a way that I can see the total number of points in the backlog, or how many points are in a particular status. I currently use the Issues Navigator to export and use filters in Excel which is extremely primitive for such an expensive tool. I would also like to know if there is a dashboard feature / plugin which I can get a view on a particular project (preferably where I can select the 'fix versions' by filter as well) and have the following summary of the current situation:

Points Issue Status

60 Done
16 In QA
47 In Progress
26 Blocked
85 Not started

234 Total points in backlog

Please implement this as soon as possible because it's extremely difficult to track projects without this view!
fields.summary: Implement a way to see the total number of points in the backlog!

As a RB user, I want to be able to select fix version for an issue in the Details view

fields.description:
This is functionality that I can envision customers wanting if they have many issues ready for release but either:
1) Have to wait to release some of them (external dependencies, think "JIRA hasn't released yet, and we need some shit from them")
2) Want to chop them into 2 releases (1 is a feature release, another is a bug fix release)
3) Only want to release 20 issues per release, but they have 30 ready for release and need to filter what goes out
fields.summary: As a RB user, I want to be able to select which issues I release from the Ready to Release column, rather than have to release everything

fields.description: When you click on an issue and open the Details view, we currently don't have tests to cover all the workflow transitions and we need these for regression purposes.
fields.summary: As a GH QA, I would like to have tests to verify workflow transitions in the Details View of an issue on the RB

fields.description:
We use 3 different levels of planning in our product backlog in our company:
- long-term (12 months)
- mid-term (3 months)
- short-term (next sprint)

The mid-term and short-term as well as the sprint planning itself is done via the planning board. Here we use the "original estimate" field to get a clue how "big" an issue will eb approximately.
We use the statistsics marker "time (remaining)" at the moment to identify which Stories may fit into the next sprint (e.g. 200h capacity in 2 weeks). It would be great if we could just add  another marker based on "time (remaining)" for the 3-month preview (e.g. 1200h in 3 months) to see which topics need to be refined to the next level of detail.

Just found this article http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Configuring+Statistics and a comment stating that it's not possible yet and we may suggest it as a story. As i haven't found an according story, i filed it yet.
fields.summary: As a GH user i want to be able to use multiple markers of the same value (e.g. original estimate) in order to see my short-term and my mid-term planning

fields.description:
Graph for Issue Burndown Chart in GH chartboard is not rendering properly if there are issues created after start date.

Steps to reproduce:
* Create 5 issues and assigned it to a version with a start date
* Later after start date has passed (or change system date), create another 5 issues
* Value for guideline won't change as expected and only remaining values will change but remaining value line will overshoot out of the graph

Check screenshot for a clear picture on the situation.
fields.summary: Issue burndown chart line overshoot if issues created after start date

- Change "Show next 5 comments" to "Show 5 more comments", load those above the prior comments
fields.summary: As a rapid board user I would like the comments to replicate the Streams behav JIRA View Issue behaviour
As a JIRA Saved Filter owner (or JIRA Administrator) I would like a notification when I am about to delete a Saved Filter that is used by a Rapid View.
As a JIRA Administrator I would like to be able to change the owner of the Rapid View

fields.description:
The statistic gadget lines on the Planning Board would be really helpful for the scrums masters during the iteration planning meeting.
The project administrators does not want a give admin rights to the scrum masters resulting that they can not use the lines to help them planning their iteration.
The number of story points, issues, business values or time remaining can vary from one agile team to another so it's not good to have one number set by the administrator for all the teams. 

The statistic gadget lines should be usable by non admin users.
fields.summary: Statistic gadget on Agile Planning Board should not be restricted to Admin Users

fields.description:
COS:
- new Reporting design from Martin including time/chart/column/quick filter/swimlane filtering
- allow selection of columns to be shown in the chart
- default to selection of all columns
- analytics for chart and filter selections incl timeframe/QF/columns/swimlanes
fields.summary: As a rapid board user I want the ability to view my charts by columns so that I can measure CFD/cycle time/etc for specific transitions

fields.description: As a Kanaban team lead I want to limit my WIP (work-in-progress) for each column on the taskboard. Further, the work items for our team vary in size and therefore we use story points as a measure of effort required for each item. Given this workflow it would be helpful if we could set column constraints that were based on the total number of story points for all issues in a given column.
fields.summary: As a GH user doing kanban I'd like to constrain task board columns based on story points

fields.description:
SiteMesh in 5.0 is more strict about what it accepts, we need to have a proper structure of
<html><head></head><body></body></html> in order to get the head elements inserted at the correct place.

Parts of this cleanup should be to move whatever variable we currently create in velocity out into a resource file, to ensure its loaded at the correct location/sequence inside the page (e.g. the GH namespace needs to be defined already for GH.abc to not explode)

Work doable in 4.4, to be forward compatible.
fields.summary: Fix up Sitemesh head/body structure used by GH (broken in 5.0)
Document https://jdog.atlassian.com/browse/JRADEV-6762 (sitemesh changes)
